alert.note: Alert for Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 21 at 8:59PM MST until December 22 at 4:00AM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 85 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Western Uinta Mountains. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 8 PM this evening to 11 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Winter driving conditions are expected. Areas of blowing and drifting snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For graphical depictions of the snowfall forecast, including Official NWS Forecast, High End Amount, and Low End Amount, visit weather.gov/slc/winter. For winter road conditions from the Utah Department of Transportation, visit http://www.udottraffic.utah.gov/roadweatherforecast.aspx or dial 511.
